dt: {bc}the act or process of {a_link|dividing} {bc}the state of being {a_link|divided}
{bc}the act, process, or an instance of distributing among a number {bc}{sx|distribution||}
{bc}one of the parts or groupings into which a whole is divided or is {a_link|divisible}
{bc}the condition or an instance of being divided in opinion or interest {bc}{sx|disagreement||}, {sx|disunity||}

dt.t: exploited the {wi}divisions{/wi} between the two countries

dt: {bc}the act, process, or an instance of separating or keeping apart {bc}{sx|separation||}
{bc}a self-contained major military unit capable of independent action
{bc}a tactical military unit composed of headquarters and usually three to five brigades
{bc}a tactical subdivision of a squadron of ships
{bc}a unit of the U.S. Air Force higher than a wing and lower than an air force
{bc}a portion of a territorial unit marked off for a particular purpose (such as administrative or judicial functions)
{bc}an administrative or operating unit of a governmental, business, or educational organization
{bc}the physical separation into different lobbies of the members of a parliamentary body voting for and against a question
{bc}plant propagation by dividing parts and planting segments capable of producing roots and shoots
{bc}a group of organisms forming part of a larger group
{bc}a primary category of the plant kingdom in biological taxonomy that is typically equivalent to a phylum
{bc}a competitive class or category (as in boxing or wrestling)

pt: {sc}part{/sc} {sc}portion{/sc} {sc}piece{/sc} {sc}member{/sc} {sc}division{/sc} {sc}section{/sc} {sc}segment{/sc} {sc}fragment{/sc} mean something less than the whole. {sc}part{/sc} is a general term appropriate when indefiniteness is required.

pt.t: they ran only {it}part{/it} of the way

pt: {sc}portion{/sc} implies an assigned or allotted part.
{sc}piece{/sc} applies to a separate or detached part of a whole.
{sc}member{/sc} suggests one of the functional units composing a body.
{sc}division{/sc} applies to a large or diversified part.
{sc}section{/sc} applies to a relatively small or uniform part.
{sc}segment{/sc} applies to a part separated or marked out by or as if by natural lines of cleavage.
{sc}fragment{/sc} applies to a part produced by or as if by breaking off.

pt.t: only a {it}fragment{/it} of the play still exists

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}devision{/it}, from Latin {it}division-, divisio{/it}, from {it}dividere{/it} to divide
shortdef: the act or process of dividing : the state of being divided
the act, process, or an instance of distributing among a number : distribution
one of the parts or groupings into which a whole is divided or is divisible

dt: {bc}occurring between or involving two or more {d_link|divisions|division}

shortdef: occurring between or involving two or more divisions
